actions.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A resolution apologizing to the victims of lynching and their descendants for the Senate's failure to enact anti-lynching legislation.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Declares that the Senate: (1) apologizes to the victims and survivors of lynching for its failure to enact anti-lynching legislation; (2) expresses its deepest sympathies and most solemn regrets to the descendants of such victims whose ancestors were deprived of life, human dignity, and the constitutional protections accorded all other U.S. citizens; and (3) remembers the history of lynching, to ensure that these personal tragedies will be neither forgotten nor repeated.

titles.title: A resolution apologizing to the victims of lynching and their descendants for the Senate's failure to enact anti-lynching legislation.
